nachos.machine

Class Timer

  • java.lang.Object
    • nachos.machine.Timer

  • public class Timer
extends java.lang.Object
    This class emulates a hardware timer device. A hardware timer generates periodic CPU interrupts. There are two kinds of timers implemented here: scheduling timers, which are associated with a particular CPU and are used to implement time-slicing on that CPU, and general-purpose timers, which can be used for other system functions that require timing, such as putting threads to sleep for specified amounts of time. The interrupts of a scheduling timer will only be "seen" by the associated CPU whereas the interrupts of a general-purpose timer can be handled by any available CPU. Both kinds of timers are set so that there is a fixed average time between interrupts. In order to introduce some randomness into time-slicing, "setRandom" can be used to cause the interval between timer interrupts to occur with random "jitter" about the average.
